thread.title: Poplar bus fire: Dramatic moment bus is engulfed in flames after 'explosion' in east London | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Poplar bus fire: Dramatic moment bus is engulfed in flames after 'explosion' in east London | London Evening Standard

author: Francesca Gillett
title: Poplar bus fire: Dramatic moment bus is engulfed in flames after 'explosion' in east London | London Evening Standard
text:
Hazard: Chelsea won the league two years ago - we know what to do now 
This was the dramatic scene as a double-decker bus "exploded" and was engulfed by flames in east London. 
Residents reported hearing a loud bang as the blaze erupted in Poplar in the early hours of Monday morning. 
Photos showed the wreckage of the bus as smoke billowed from it. 
People living in an apartment block near to Aspen Way, near Blackwall DLR station and East India dock, said they awoke in the early hours of Monday morning to a loud explosion. Blaze: The bus on fire on Aspen Way in east London. (Daniel Hodgson) 
Daniel Hodgson, 32, described how he saw smoke was seeping through his open window at his flat on Blackwall Way. 
He told the Standard : “I was asleep and I just heard a bang. It was loud, I’m quite a heavy sleeper. 
“I was quite dazed but I smelt smoke which was coming through the window. Billowing: Clouds of smoke rise from the burning bus in Poplar. (Daniel Hodgson) 
“The police and fire engines came and they were putting it out. The roads around were closed off.” 
Varun Vashist, who lives nearby, told the Standard: “We woke up by the sound of multiple blasts. Initially we just saw the thick smoke coming from the side of the building. 
“We immediately went down thinking it’s a building fire. Many others did the same. Aftermath: The wreckage of the double decker bus. (Daniel Hodgson) 
“We then saw the bus. The firefighters told us it’s safe to go back but to keep the windows closed.” 
The burning bus was empty and there were no reports of any injuries, a spokesman for the Met Police said. 
It appears the driver got out of the bus before the police were called at 12.49am, he added. Fire: The view from an apartment block in Blackwall Way. (Daniel Hodgson) 
Other people living nearby said the scene looked “absolutely awful” while many expressed concern for the bus driver. — Marlène Court (@marlenecourt) February 27, 2017 Just saw a whole London bus on fire — Christopher (@OhNoesItsChris) February 27, 2017 
Photos taken in daylight on Monday morning show the wreckage of the bus, which appears to have been burnt to less than half its size. 
Roads nearby including the East India Dock Tunnel were shut overnight while emergency services dealt with the incident. 
Ambulance staff were called to the blaze but confirmed no one was injured. 
The London Fire Brigade has been contacted for comment. More about:
